name: List
description: List component for item collections with filtering and pagination. Provides comprehensive functionality for displaying searchable, filterable, and paginated content collections.

vertical_spacing.description: Vertical spacing position for the list container.

with_background.description: Whether to display the list with a background.

link_above.description: Link object displayed above the list content.

link_below.description: Link object displayed below the list content.

rows_above.description: Content rows displayed above the main list.

rows_below.description: Content rows displayed below the main list.

rows.description: Main list rows and items content.

empty.description: Content displayed when no results are found.

footer.description: Footer content area for additional information.

examples.name: Basic List
examples.description: Simple list with title and rows

examples.name: Filtered List
examples.description: List with filters and search functionality

props.title: Search Results
props.empty: No results found. Please try adjusting your search criteria.

when_to_use: Display collections of content items (articles, products, events)
Create searchable and filterable content listings
Present paginated results with navigation controls
Organize large datasets into manageable views
when_not_to_use: For simple, static lists - use basic list components instead
When items don't need filtering or pagination
For navigation menus - use navigation components
When content is better presented in other formats (grids, cards)
best_practices: Provide clear list titles that describe the content type
Include result counts to help users understand the scope
Implement accessible filter and search controls
Provide meaningful empty states with helpful guidance
Use consistent item formatting throughout the list
Implement proper loading states for dynamic content
Ensure pagination is accessible and keyboard navigable

accessibility.notes: Component provides proper semantic markup for list structures with accessible filter controls and pagination.

variations: Background options: With or without background styling
Spacing: Top, bottom, or both vertical spacing
Content sections: Above/below links and rows for additional content
Filter integration: Exposed filters and search controls
Pagination: Built-in pagination support for large datasets

findings: Users expect filter and search functionality in content lists
Clear result counts help users understand search effectiveness
Pagination controls should be easily accessible and understandable
Empty states should provide helpful guidance for next steps
Consistent list item formatting improves scanability
